thread.title: Biden to announce presidential run decision: report
thread.title_full: Biden to announce presidential run decision: report - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Biden to announce presidential run decision: report
text:
Andrew Harnik/AP Vice President Biden reacts to questions about his potential run for president from the media at the Naval Observatory in Washington on Oct. 15. WASHINGTON — Vice President Biden will likely announce his decision on whether to run for president in the next 48 hours, according to NBC.
Sources tell the network that Biden is moving fast towards a decision.
The potential presidential candidate has blown through self-imposed deadlines before — he’s well past his initial plan to decide by the end of summer — but pressure is mounting from all sides for him to make an ultimate decision, with both supporters and neutral Democrats arguing he needs to pull the trigger if he is to run.
Biden’s team has been increasingly ramping up towards a possible bid in the last week, suggesting to many that he’s leaning towards a campaign.
Draft Joe Biden/via YouTube A grab from an advertisment imploring Joe Biden to run for the 2016 presidency aired on the same day the CNN democratic debate. Former Sen. Ted Kaufman, Biden’s longtime chief of staff, emailed Biden-land late last week outlining what a campaign could look like thematically and asking for backers’ help if Biden takes the plunge, while the Vice President himself has been meeting with top potential backers — including a Friday call with the head of the powerful International Association of Fire Fighters.
The Democratic establishment has largely rallied around front-runner Hillary Clinton, though a handful of influential unions have suggested they might back Biden.
A source close to Biden tells CBS that the Vice President isn’t too concerned that establishment Democrats are circling the wagons around Clinton.
JONATHAN ERNST/REUTERS NBC has stated that Vice President Biden will likely announce whether or not he plans to run for president within the next 48 hours. “He does not like bullies and he will not be bullied,” said the source. “He has never been a part of the Democratic establishment and could care less about it.”
